entries.meaning: Either rear half of a side of beef, mutton, veal, lamb or by extension from another edible mammal.
(in the plural) The hind biped (leg) of a quadruped, or all body parts situated behind the hind legs' trunk-attachment.
examples: While Major was speaking four large rats had crept out of their holes and were sitting on their hindquarters, listening to him.

entries.meaning: (metonymically, derogatory, usually in the plural) Human behind, butt.
